item.text: Josiah was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned for thirty-one years in Jerusalem.
He did what the Lord approved and followed in his ancestor David’s footsteps; he did not deviate to the right or the left.

In the eighth year of his reign, while he was still young, he began to seek the God of his ancestor David. In his twelfth year he began ridding Judah and Jerusalem of the high places, Asherah poles, idols, and images.

He <st data-num="06440" class="">ordered</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altars</st> of the <st data-num="01168" class="">Baals</st> to be <st data-num="05422" class="">torn down</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="01438" class="">broke</st> the <st data-num="02553" class="">incense altars</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> were <st data-num="04605 05921">above</st> them. He <st data-num="07665" class="">smashed</st> the <st data-num="0842" class="">Asherah poles</st>, <st data-num="06456" class="">idols</st>, and <st data-num="04541" class="">images</st>, <st data-num="01854" class="">crushed</st> them, and <st data-num="02236" class="">sprinkled</st> the dust <st data-num="05921 06440">over</st> the <st data-num="06913" class="">tombs</st> of those who had <st data-num="02076" class="">sacrificed</st> to them.

He <st data-num="08313" class="">burned</st> the <st data-num="06106" class="">bones</st> of the pagan <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> their <st data-num="04196" class="">altars</st>; he <st data-num="02891" class="">purified</st> <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.

In the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st>, <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st>, and <st data-num="08095" class="">Simeon</st>, <st data-num="05704" class="">as far as</st> <st data-num="05321" class="">Naphtali</st>, and in the <st data-num="02723" class="">ruins</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st> them,
he tore down the altars and Asherah poles, demolished the idols, and smashed all the incense altars throughout the land of Israel. Then he returned to Jerusalem.

In the eighteenth year of his reign, he continued his policy of purifying the land and the temple. He sent Shaphan son of Azaliah, Maaseiah the city official, and Joah son of Joahaz the secretary to repair the temple of the Lord his God.

They <st data-num="0935" class="">went</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02518" class="">Hilkiah</st> the <st data-num="01419" class="">high</st> <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> him the <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> that had been <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> to <st data-num="0430" class="">God’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>. The <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> who <st data-num="08104" class="">guarded</st> the <st data-num="05592" class="">door</st> had <st data-num="0622" class="">collected</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">it</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">from</st> the people of<n id="1" /> <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st> and <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st> and from <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="07611" class="">who were left</st> in <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, as well as from <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the people of<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st> and the <st data-num="03427" class="">residents</st> of<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.
They handed it over to the construction foremen assigned to the Lord’s temple. They in turn paid the temple workers to restore and repair it.

They <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> money to the <st data-num="02796" class="">craftsmen</st> and <st data-num="01129" class="">builders</st> to <st data-num="07069" class="">buy</st> <st data-num="04274" class="">chiseled</st> <st data-num="068" class="">stone</st> and <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> for the <st data-num="04226" class="">braces</st> and <st data-num="07136" class="">rafters</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">buildings</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> had <st data-num="07843" class="">allowed to fall into disrepair</st>.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="0582" class="">men</st> <st data-num="06213 04399">worked</st> <st data-num="0530" class="">faithfully</st>. Their <st data-num="05921 06485 05329">supervisors</st> were <st data-num="03189" class="">Jahath</st> and <st data-num="05662" class="">Obadiah</st> (<st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">descended</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> <st data-num="04847" class="">Merari</st>), as well as <st data-num="02148" class="">Zechariah</st> and <st data-num="04918" class="">Meshullam</st> (<st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> <st data-num="06956" class="">Kohath</st>). The <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st>, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> of whom were <st data-num="0995" class="">skilled</st> <st data-num="03627 07892">musicians</st>,
supervised the laborers and all the foremen on their various jobs. Some of the Levites were scribes, officials, and guards.
When they took out the silver that had been brought to the Lord’s temple, Hilkiah the priest found the law scroll the Lord had given to Moses.
Hilkiah informed Shaphan the scribe, “I found the law scroll in the Lord’s temple.” Hilkiah gave the scroll to Shaphan.

<st data-num="08227" class="">Shaphan</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> the <st data-num="05612" class="">scroll</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> and <st data-num="07725 05750 04428 01697 0559">reported</st>,<n id="1" /> “Your <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">are</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">doing</st> <st data-num="03605 0834">everything</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">assigned</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">to</st> them.
They melted down the silver in the Lord’s temple and handed it over to the supervisors and the construction foremen.”

Then <st data-num="08227" class="">Shaphan</st> the <st data-num="05608" class="">scribe</st> <st data-num="05046 0559">told</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>, “<st data-num="02518" class="">Hilkiah</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> has <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> me a <st data-num="05612" class="">scroll</st>.” <st data-num="08227" class="">Shaphan</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">read</st> it <st data-num="07121" class="">out loud</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>.

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> the <st data-num="01697" class="">words</st> of the <st data-num="08451" class="">law</st>, he <st data-num="07167" class="">tore</st> his <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="06680 0559">ordered</st> <st data-num="02518" class="">Hilkiah</st>, <st data-num="0296" class="">Ahikam</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08227" class="">Shaphan</st>, <st data-num="05658" class="">Abdon</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="04318" class="">Micah</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08227" class="">Shaphan</st> the <st data-num="05608" class="">scribe</st>, and <st data-num="06222" class="">Asaiah</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>,

“Go, ask the Lord for me and for those who remain in Israel and Judah about the words of this scroll that has been discovered. For the Lord’s great fury has been ignited against us because our ancestors did not obey the word of the Lord by living according to all that is written in this scroll.”

So Hilkiah and the others sent by the king went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum son of Tokhath, the son of Hasrah, the supervisor of the wardrobe. (She lived in Jerusalem in the Mishneh district.) They stated their business,
and she said to them: “This is what the Lord God of Israel says: ‘Say this to the man who sent you to me:
“This is what the Lord says: ‘I am about to bring disaster on this place and its residents, all the curses that are recorded in the scroll which they read before the king of Judah.

This will happen <st data-num="08478 0834">because</st> they have <st data-num="05800" class="">abandoned</st> me and <st data-num="06999" class="">offered sacrifices</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st>, <st data-num="04616 03707">angering</st> me with <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04639" class="">idols</st> they have <st data-num="03027" class="">made</st>.<n id="2" /> My <st data-num="02534" class="">anger</st> will <st data-num="05413" class="">ignite</st> against <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> and will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="03518" class="">extinguished</st>!’”
Say this to the king of Judah, who sent you to seek an oracle from the Lord: “This is what the Lord God of Israel says concerning the words you have heard:

‘You displayed a sensitive spirit and humbled yourself before God when you heard his words concerning this place and its residents. You humbled yourself before me, tore your clothes, and wept before me, and I have heard you,’ says the Lord.
‘Therefore I will allow you to die and be buried in peace. You will not have to witness all the disaster I will bring on this place and its residents.’”’” Then they reported back to the king.
The king summoned all the leaders of Judah and Jerusalem.

The king went up to the Lord’s temple, accompanied by all the people of Judah, the residents of Jerusalem, the priests, and the Levites. All the people were there, from the oldest to the youngest. He read aloud all the words of the scroll of the covenant that had been discovered in the Lord’s temple.

The king stood by his pillar and renewed the covenant before the Lord, agreeing to follow the Lord and to obey his commandments, laws, and rules with all his heart and being, by carrying out the terms of this covenant recorded on this scroll.

He <st data-num="05975" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> who <st data-num="04672" class="">were</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> and <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">agree</st> to it.<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="03427" class="">residents</st> of <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">acted</st> in accordance with the <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st> of <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>, the <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> of their <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st>.

Josiah removed all the detestable idols from all the areas belonging to the Israelites and encouraged all who were in Israel to worship the Lord their God. Throughout the rest of his reign they did not turn aside from following the Lord God of their ancestors.
